For this special day, we opted for a particular format, with less science than usual, the idea being to show whatâ€™s going on behind the scenes. We had a roundtable on the link between research, managers and citizens. We also had several short unorthodox talks where we tried to analyse why some of our papers/projects were successful, but also why we failed at being read or funded. Interestingly, Rob Salguero-Gomez, a colleague of ours, wrote a nice piece on the topic here. Last, we gathered several persons with various professional profiles so that our students could ask them all the questions they wanted. Overall, I think it went amazingly well, and all the attendees found something to take home with them.
